isis.stitle: DT/DTA-466 Diesel Engine Service (1990) - WATER PUMP AND THERMOSTAT - THERMOSTAT - COMPONENT CHANGES

svcprocinfo.para: Effective with Engine S/N 567492 changes were made to the cooling system to increase cab heat and engine warm-up. With the increased sized water pump by-pass inlet, as described in TIMING GEAR TRAIN AND FRONT COVER, is a change to the thermostat By-pass hose and housing.

svcsubproc.title: Thermostat By-pass Hose
svcsubproc.para:
The thermostat by-pass hose has been increased in diameter and length. Refer to the Engine Parts Catalog for the proper number for service as the hoses do NOT interchange. Refer to Figure 10.22
for dimensions.

svcsubproc.title: Thermostat Housing
svcsubproc.para:
Changes to the thermostat housing are: ( Figure 10.23
)

item.para: The water deaeration 1/8"-27 NPTF tapped hole and pipe plug located on top of the 1988 model year thermostat housing is relocated to the front side of the thermostat housing.
A new 1/2"-14 NPTF tapped hole and hex-plug replace the water deaeration 1/8"-27 NPTF tapped hole and plug on top of the new thermostat housing. This new hole is used for additional sensor mountings.
The inside and outside diameters of the thermostat housing water pump by-pass hose inlet are increased to coincide with the enlargements to the water pump by-pass hose and crankcase front cover.
